content: a good practice to work a re-enforced heel flap instead this involves slipping every other st in the k row which creates a layer of yarn floats on the inside of the sock that will strengthen and cushion the flap row 1 sl1 kwise sl1 pwise k1 to last st k1 turn row 2 sl1 pwise p to end turn row 3 sl1 kwise k1 sl 1 pwise to last st k1 turn row 4 sl1 pwise p to end turn repeat these 4 row until the heel flap is the desired length there is a rule of thumb that says to work the flap as many row as you have sts i e 32 in this case but this refers to a plain flap in the re-enforced flap style every stitch is only worked 3 times every 4 row so you will need more row i suggest 40 row in total for a 32 st flap heel turn ultimately we want to return to knitting our sock in the round again to get a nice foot shape and to help getting us in the right position for this we will need to work what is called a heel turn unsurprisingly there are also various options to do this and a plethora of options can be seen in historical extant socks but we will work what is called a french handkerchief or horseshoe heel turn depending on who s doing the naming row 1 sl 1 kwise k16 half your heel sts ssk k1 turn this should leave 12 sts un- worked on your left needle row 2 sl 1 pwise p3 p2tog p1 turn again this will leave 12 sts unworked on the left needle if you look at your work on your needles you should be able to distinguish 3 clear sections 12 sts then the 6 active sts in the centre and another 12 sts on the other side each section separated by a gap where we have turned to change direction as you continue back and forth you will slowly increase the centre part as you decrease and so use up the sts on either side row 3 sl1 kwise k to 1 st before the gap ssk k1 turn row 4 sl1 pwise p to 1 st before the gap p2tog p1 turn repeat these last two row until all st are back in work you should have 18 sts in total and be ready to work a rs row sock page 5 sl1 kwise k8 this is the centre of the heel and your new beginning of the rounds that will follow to work in rounds again we firstly need to have stitches that go all around the heel so we will pick them up next in a kind of set-up round whatever method you are using for knitting your socks an extra dpn will definitely come in handy here with needle 1 k the 9 remaining sts from the heel turn with the
